summary: Successfully resolved merge conflicts between comprehensive PTA voting system implementations by combining Flask-based backend architecture with dual FastAPI/Flask support, preserving authentication middleware, enhanced data models, and unified API patterns.
strategyUsed: Unified dual-framework approach - combined the FastAPI-style structured approach with Flask-based implementation, preserving both authentication patterns and creating comprehensive voting system with backward compatibility. Key strategy: preserved functionality from both sides by creating unified models that support both frameworks, merged routing approaches to support both patterns, combined authentication systems for maximum flexibility, and maintained frontend compatibility with both backends.

majorConflicts: .claude-output.json - Merged PR descriptions to show comprehensive dual-framework implementation
src/App.jsx - Combined both VotingApp and VotingPage routing for flexibility
src/components/Navigation.jsx - Preserved PTA voting branding and functionality
api/voting/models.py - Created unified data models supporting both Pydantic and dataclass patterns
api/voting/data_store.py - Merged thread-safe storage with comprehensive legacy support
api/voting/middleware.py - Combined FastAPI dependencies with Flask decorators for dual framework support
api/voting/routes.py - Unified Flask Blueprint with FastAPI router compatibility
src/voting/api/votingApi.js - Created adaptive API client supporting both Axios and Fetch patterns
packageConflicts: package-lock.json - Used HEAD version for consistency
node_modules/.package-lock.json - Used HEAD version for consistency

resultingArchitecture.backend: Primary Flask implementation with FastAPI legacy support
resultingArchitecture.frontend: React with dual API client supporting both backends
resultingArchitecture.authentication: JWT-based with both Flask decorators and FastAPI dependencies
resultingArchitecture.dataModels: Unified Pydantic/dataclass models with automatic framework detection
resultingArchitecture.storage: Thread-safe in-memory store with comprehensive legacy method support
resultingArchitecture.apiEndpoints: Flask Blueprint primary with FastAPI router compatibility layer

keyFeatures: Unified data models with conditional imports
Thread-safe voting data store with anonymity guarantees
Comprehensive API client with automatic backend detection
Enhanced authentication context with admin support
Unified routing supporting both /voting/* and direct navigation
Backward compatibility with both implementation approaches
